abstract_summ: Using daily time series of COVID-19 incidence, we illustrate how epidemic curves of reported cases may not always reflect the true epidemic growth rate due to changes in testing rates, which could be influenced by limited diagnostic testing capacity during the early epidemic phase.The results offered many important predictions of the COVID-19 virus epidemic such as realistic number of victims, infection rate, peak time, and other characteristics.In the present study, the known SIR model was used for the dynamics of an epidemic to provide a suitable assessment of the COVID-19 virus epidemic in Iran.We estimate the infection rate to be 0.258 using a least square method with Poisson noise and estimate the reproduction number to be 2.58.The epidemic curve and SIR model parameters were obtained with the use of Iran statistical data.
title_summ: Predication of Pandemic COVID-19 situation in Maharashtra, IndiaPrediction of the Peak, Effect of Intervention and Total Infected by the Coronavirus Disease in IndiaPrediction of Peak and Termination of Novel Coronavirus Covid-19 Epidemic in IranEstimating the last day for COVID-19 outbreak in mainland ChinaThe Reconstruction and Prediction Algorithm of the Fractional TDD for the Local Outbreak of COVID-19Modeling the dynamics of novel coronavirus (2019-nCov) with fractional derivativeChanges in testing rates could mask the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) growth rate
title_abstract_phrases: Using daily time series of COVID-19 incidence, we illustrate how epidemic curves of reported cases may not always reflect the true epidemic growth rate due to changes in testing rates, which could be influenced by limited diagnostic testing capacity during the early epidemic phase.The results offered many important predictions of the COVID-19 virus epidemic such as realistic number of victims, infection rate, peak time, and other characteristics.Changes in testing rates could mask the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) growth rateAbstract Since the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) emerged in December 2019 in China, it has rapidly propagated to around the world, leading to one of the most significant pandemic events of recent history.We estimate the infection rate to be 0.258 using a least square method with Poisson noise and estimate the reproduction number to be 2.58.In the present study, the known SIR model was used for the dynamics of an epidemic to provide a suitable assessment of the COVID-19 virus epidemic in Iran.
